academicRules 1.0.0
  • Reference

Simulate a policy change by modifying or removing rules

simulate_policy_change.Rd

Creates a temporary copy of the ruleset, applies your requested modifications (e.g., changing the value for a rule or removing a rule entirely), and then applies the updated ruleset to the dataset to get a new outcome column.

Usage

simulate_policy_change(
  data,
  ruleset,
  modifications = list(),
  outcome_col_name = "OUTCOME_CHANGED"
)

Arguments

data

A data frame or tibble containing student/entity data.

ruleset

An object of class academic_ruleset from define_rule_set.

modifications

A named list of modifications. Each name must match a rule in ruleset. The value is either:

  • A list of fields to change (e.g., list(value=26)),

  • NULL, indicating that the rule should be removed entirely.

outcome_col_name

A string for the new outcome column (e.g. "OUTCOME_CHANGED").

Value

A copy of data with a new column outcome_col_name containing the results of applying the modified ruleset.

Details

  • Modifying a rule: Provide a named list of fields to change, e.g., list(minimum_score = list(value=26)) will set rules$minimum_score$value = 26.

  • Removing a rule: Provide NULL instead of a list for the rule, e.g. list(cas_requirement = NULL). This completely removes the rule from the ruleset (and from rule_priority).

See also

apply_rules for applying a ruleset directly.

Examples

# Example: raising a minimum threshold and removing a logical rule (based on IBDP passing criteria)
df <- data.frame(score = c(24,25,30), CAS_met = c(FALSE, TRUE, TRUE))

rs <- define_rule_set(
  list(
    cas_rule = list(type = "logical", expr = ~ CAS_met),
    min_score = list(type = "minimum", value = 24, dimension = "score")
  ),
  default_outcome = "PASS"
)

# Baseline classification
baseline <- apply_rules(df, rs, outcome_col_name = "BASE_OUTCOME")

# Now remove 'cas_rule' and raise 'min_score' to 26
modifications <- list(
  cas_rule = NULL,             # remove the CAS rule
  min_score = list(value = 26) # raise threshold from 24 to 26
)

changed <- simulate_policy_change(df, rs, modifications, "NEW_OUTCOME")
#> Removing rule 'cas_rule' from the ruleset.

cbind(baseline, changed["NEW_OUTCOME"])
#>   score CAS_met BASE_OUTCOME NEW_OUTCOME
#> 1    24   FALSE         FAIL        FAIL
#> 2    25    TRUE         PASS        FAIL
#> 3    30    TRUE         PASS        PASS
